data: It was either Plato the Athenian, or Confucius the Chinese, or Andromachus the Cretan—or some other philosopher whose name I disremember—that remarked once upon a time, and the time was many centuries ago, that no woman was happy until she got herself a home.

The House
An Episode in the Lives of Reuben Baker, Astronomer, and of His Wife, Alice
